title: Bad Block / invalid merkle root
body:
Hi, what additional info do you need? :) 
I will need to get the system up and running soon, as it is my backup system, so problaly I'll try syncing from 0 tomorrow. I hope you can tell me what you need before I get anxious as I have no backup :P 

And BTW: Thanks for the awesome work on the client!

#### System information

Geth version: 1.9.25 (I think)
OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04

#### Expected behaviour
Syncing

#### Actual behaviour
Not Syncing --> Bad block / invalid merkle root

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
No idea, maybe my VM did crash and I did not notice.

#### journal snippet

```

[snip]
```
Are you using the snapshot? Can you provide the commands to start the Geth?
I followed Somer Esat's guide. It synced from 0 in fast mode and was shut off for a few days after it was synced.
Do you still have the data-dir?

No, sorry. I reset the db.

Ah BTW, is it possible this bug occured because I just ran out of memory/swap space? I ran the VM with ~6 GB of RAM with the prysmbeacon client in parallel. I did not have a look at the RAM/swap usage when I noticed the bug.
yes this is very much possible.
